name: Hotel Secreto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful and incredible hotel, the rooms are great clean and the attetion by hotel staff is just splendid. This hotel and Isla Mujeres are just paradise, if youre looking to party all night long just like a spring breaker this is not for you. This hotel is just so relaxing you would do anything not to go back.
reviews.title: The perfect hotel!!
Beautiful White Candy Box!
reviews.text: When I went they were building a spa center and looks like is gonna be great. I will surely go back next year.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything is close at walking distance and the hotel staff can give you excelente recommendations depending on what youre looking for.
reviews.title: great value, great location, great time

reviews.text: If you like boutique hotels then this is the place for you. This is my fourth visit to Secreto and I have yet to be disappointed. This hotel is small, chic and unique. There are original works of art all over the hotel. It is small, special and one of a kind. I go out of my way to stay at boutique hotels all over the world and this is my favorite. There is something magical about the place. Part of the charm of Isla Mujeres is that it is a genuine, one of a kind place. I have been going to the island since I got married 22 years ago. Once you leave the main street you will find an island of lovely kind people who really care about their home. If you are looking for Disney or mindless entertainment, stop reading this review and go to Cancun.
reviews.title: Overated for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is clean, chic, modern and simple. It is the perfect place to elicit a sense of calm and quiet. The staff is incredibly accommodating. The ac is intense, but for those who complain, don’t know how to use it! It hits the beds only if you direct the unit to it. The ac is a wall unit, and it is not central ac, but does the trick cooling the room down and we were there in august.
reviews.title: Great Getaway at the very chic Secreto!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: have just returned from a six night stay at the secreto hotel on isla mujeres and wanted to make a review from a hoteliers perspective, having worked in the hospitality industry for over 20 years.
reviews.title: from a hoteliers point of view ....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The island: Is stunning - we loved the village area of the island where you will find lots of tourist shops, plenty of fabulous mexican restaurants and coffee shops and along the beach front some of the best seafood we have eaten. Superb.
reviews.title: Best kept secret in Mexico

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beaches are spectacular, beautiful blue sea - and very windy when we were there,
reviews.title: Like walking into a dream .... and staying there

reviews.text: Hotel Secreto sits on the north of the island so the down side is the beach is not the best point of the island and as it is north facing - no sun hits the front of the rooms all day.
reviews.title: That Little Special Something

reviews.text: First impressions when you arrive at the hotel is its like a small miami beach house, 11 rooms in total - and the web site is pretty impressive, had plenty of great pr from conde naste - claiming to be the best boutique hotel in mexico for under 200 $.
reviews.title: Renos are complete! Back to cool...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were slightly nervous about booking this hotel due to the mixed reviews, however we took a risk and are very glad we did, In my view the negative reviews are likely to come from people who prefer 5* resort hotel luxury, which this is definitely not. It is a small boutique hotel and it is its uniqueness that makes it special.
reviews.title: Beautiful hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room (9) was perfect and being on the 3rd floor we had a gorgeous view of the sea. The pool was fantastic, quiet and plenty of loungers for all the guests, temperature was perfect. The cocktails are delicious, and if you can't be bothered to move from your lounger for lunch or dinner you can order from local restaurants who will deliver.
reviews.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: The condo development next door is currently stalled and appears to have been for some time. There is a lot of stalled development on the island and I doubt these projects will start up again until the global economy improves.
reviews.title: Simply Paradise...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed shortly after the swine flu outbreak and the island was noticeably quiet although the hotel seemed to have higher occupancy than many others. We were very pleased to get an email shortly before we arrived saying the room rate had been reduced by $100US since we booked!
reviews.title: Secreto = happiness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only criticism I have is the breakfast, which whilst adequate could be very easily improved with a choice of cereals and jams, and better fruit selection.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel- will definitely be back

reviews.text: I just read the "Overrated" review and thought I should finally send this review that I have hesitated in writing. First, I have stayed at the hotel since its' inception. The prior awards and positive review were well-deserved. The place was lovely, serene, catered to a quiet, private kind of traveler and I thought exceptional for the price. The pool area chairs and beds were covered with beautiful terry coverings, large rolled towels in abundance, foliage perfectly maintained, nice quiet beach area, careful attention paid to pretty lighting. In 2008 I stayed and thought things were falling off a bit - the towels were stained, the pool area not maintained as well but still a nice place. My trip this past month would be the last time I would consider staying unless I was convinced it was restored to it's former beauty. I am hopeful because I don't think they would be investing as much time and expense to a spa and gym if they didn't intend to make the rest of the place up to standard and I really do believe the owner is dedicated to excellence. My guess is that they are working around the clock to get this place ready for high season - if that is the case and I find out it's back in line I will continue to vacation there. If the hotel reads this I hope they take a few suggestions to heart:
reviews.title: Longing for Former Glory
Overrated
reviews.text: 1. Explain to the guests what is going on with the plans. If this is a first timer there you will not see repeat business, even at 1/2 price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Have the staff follow Victor's lead with how to interact with guests. He was helpful, gracious, offered drinks and food and always made you feel as though he was there to optimize the experience. The rest of the staff is very nice but so "hands off" you feel like a bother when you ask for anything. Perhaps incorrectly following the lead of the very reserved owner?
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Check in with your repeat customers - ask them how things are, what you can do to improve, their genuine opinion of their stay. It's your best source for good information and will allow you to deliver the message to your most important clients that their opinions carry weight. Most people will just go away and never come back without a word, close to what I consider doing now.
reviews.title: Wonderful service and hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 4. Offer repeat customer's an incentive to come back - some special discount, 5 nights with the 6th free, whatever. After the last two stays I for one would appreciate something to inspire me to come back.
reviews.title: very cool...

description: Conde Nast Traveler's 50 Best New Hotels in the World. Hotel Secreto is a sleek nine-room hideaway - Santorini-meets-Schrager style. Constantly upgrading, the hotel was renovated in 2005 to include a 20 meter lap pool and an all junior suite lay-out. Designed by an award-winning architect, the hotel looks more like a slick private beach house. Modern touches such as WI-FI and pre-loaded iPods are part of an enhanced poolside service.
